ModMetaData.name: Arrest and Release
ModMetaData.author: 1trickPonyta
ModMetaData.description:
Arresting your colonists during mental breaks only to immediately release them for the chance at a different mental break has become a bit more micro since the 1.3 update.
Introducing the Arrest and release command, which allows you to arrest a colonist and immediately release them in just one click.
- You don't need to have a prison to use this command, just a room that *could* be a prison if you were to place a sleeping spot inside. - The arrestee also doesn't drop their weapon or their inventory so you don't have to micro-manage them to pick everything back up. - If the arrestee has an ideology role, they will not lose it (there is no mood debuff for losing it by becoming a prisoner anyway).
This mod tries to stay true to the vanilla mechanics. You shouldn't be able to do anything you couldn't do before; you just don't have to click as much. As such:
- If the arresting pawn drops the arrestee before the arrest and release is complete, the arrestee will become a prisoner and drop their inventory as usual. - After the command completes, the arrestee will still get the Was imprisoned mood debuff. - If the arrest would reduce the number of free colonists of an ideology to one, the ideology roles will still deactivate.
